conclusion: The problem involves determining the internal resistance of a silicon photocell based on a given U-I graph.
The graph shows two lines: line 'a' representing the U-I characteristic of a battery and line 'b' representing a resistor.
The open-circuit voltage \\( U_{oc} \\) is identified as 5 V from the y-intercept of line 'a'.
The short-circuit current \\( I_{sc} \\) is identified as 0.4 A from the x-intercept of line 'a'.
The slope of line 'a' is calculated as -12.5 V/A.
The internal resistance \\( r \\) is determined to be 12.5 Ω based on the slope of line 'a'.
The intersection point of lines 'a' and 'b' indicates a voltage of 2.5 V and a current of 0.2 A.
The resistance \\( R \\) of the resistor is calculated as 12.5 Ω using Ohm's Law.
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell is confirmed to be 12.5 Ω.
